result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Adam Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid within the first 30 days on Extended Supervision.

The defendant must obtain his GED.

The defendant must become employed within the first 4 months on Extended Supervision.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:16 AM. Also called 15CF135, 15CF80, 15CF56, and 15CF65. State - here for sentencing on all matters - have complied with victim notification requirements on all files and one restitution request and no VIS provided. Cveykus - 14CF153 - previously plead to counts #2 and #3; 15CF65 - previously plead to #1 and #4; 15CF80 - previously plead to counts #1 and #3; will be pleading today to remaining cases. State - PSI was ordered in previously plead cases. Cveykus - 15CF156 - plead to count #1 deleting the repeater, #2 - deleting the repeater, #3 - deleting the repeater, DRI counts #4, #5, #6, #7, #8 and #9; 15CF135 - plead to count #1 deleting repeater, #2 - plead to and delete repeater, #4 - plead to and deleting repeater, #6 - plead to and deleting repeater, DRI counts #3, #5, #7, #8, #9 and #10; 9 year prison sentence with 4 in and 5 out. Cveykus - 14CF153 - count #2 - 30 days in jail, #3 - 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - concurrent to count #2; 15CF65 - count #1 - 9 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES; count #4 - 9 months county jail - concurrent; 15CF135 - count #1 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, count #2 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, count #4 - 9 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 4 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, #6 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, 15CF80 - count #1 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES,, 15CF56 - count #1 - 9 months county jail, #2 - 9 months county jail, count #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, - all concurrent with each other, 83 days credit. Discussion on credit. Cveykus would prefer that the JOC not reflect any credit at this time and it will be handled thru stip and order. State agrees. Sate - restitution in case #15CF56 of $2800.00 plus VW surcharge to victim (LL). Bradley agrees with recommendation as stated. Court - 15CF56 - amends #1 to delete repeater allegations, pleads G as amended; count #2 - amend to delete repeater allegations - pleads G as amended, #3 - amend to delete repeater allegation, pleads G as amended; 15CF135 - count #1, #2, #4 and #6 - amend all to delete repeater allegations, Bradley pleads G to counts #1, #2, #4 and #6 as amended, court DRI counts  #3, #5, #7, #8, #9 and #10, on 15CF56, Court DRI counts #4, #5, #6, #7, #8 and #9. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State and Cveykus have PSI, no errors noticed by Cveykus, court will not consider any part of the PSI that dealt with the Compass Evaluation. State agrees and has no objections. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - State asking that if the Court orders the defendant eligible for programs that it not begin until after half of his sentence is served but prefers the defendant not be eligible for those programs for stated reasons. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks court to make him eligible for programs after serving the first year in prison. Bradley makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF80 - #1 - 3.5 in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #3 - 6 in prison with 3 in and 3 out; 15CF56 - #1 - 9 months in county jail, #2 - 9 months in county jail, #3 - 6 years in prison with 3 in and 3 out, restitution of $2800.00 plus VW surcharge - take bond posted - remainder to be paid witin 90 days of incarceration; 15CF135 - #1 - 3.5 years in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #2 - 3.5 years in prison with 1.5 in and 2 out, #4 - 9 years in prison with 4 in and 5 out, #6 - 6 years in prison with 3 in and 3 out; 15CF65, #1 - 9 years in prison with 4 in and 5 out, #4 - 9 months in county jail; 14CF153 - #2 - 2 years in prison with 1 in and 1 out, #3 - 30 days in county jail, each count on each case are to be concurrent with each other, each sentence in each case will be concurrent; conditions include: no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, costs on each counts - to be paid within 30 days on ES, obtain GED, employment/school and obtain a job within the first 4 months on ES, eligible for both programs after serving the first 2 years of his sentence, credit to be determined by counsel thru stip and order and to be completed within 2 weeks - otherwise a hearing will be set, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no right to vote, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 9:47 AM. Called 15CF153, 15CF65, 15CF135, 15CF80, 15CF56. Cveykus - DA  Simono had an agreement previously but there was one issue that wasn't clear, possibly restitution, court will adjourn all cases to allow parties to resolve.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
that the PSI report be released to Attorney Cveykus for review. Clerk emailed.
Defendant's Motion to Strike Pre-Sentence Investigation Report (filed by Amy Ferguson)

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:08 PM. Also called 15CF80 and 15CF65. State - here on bail bond hearings due to non-appearance. Ferguson, believes we need to quash the warrant on all these cases, and set bond on all these matters and set all matters for sentencing hearing as plea has already been given. State - bond - asks for remand and no bond. Ferguson objects - being held on a probation hold and $5000.00 cash bond on new charges, asking for modest cash bond on each of these case and set these matters for sentencing hearing. State - PSI has been filed and parties are free to argue. Court remands the defendant without bond and sets for sentencing hearing on all these matters.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:13 PM. Also called 15CF80, 15CF65 and 14CF153. Cirilli represents the defendant on 15CF56 and Amy Ferguson represents the defendant on the other matters. Cirilli asks for adjournment as does Ferguson. State requests forfeiture of any bond posted and asks for bench warrant. Cirilli objects to bond forfeiture as does Ferguson. Court forfeits any bond posted, issues bench warrant, body only on all cases.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:57 PM. Also called 15CF65 and 15CF80. State - resolved. Ferguson - 14CF153 - #1 - DRI, #2 and #3 - plead NC as alleged, State requesting PSI; 15CF65 - plead NC to count #1 as alleged, counts #2 and #3 - DRI, amend #4 to misd BJ with NC plea with PSI; 15CF80 - plead NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, counts #2 and #4 - DRI, PSI request, defense asks for PSI be ordered for background information only with a no recommendation on sentencing PSI. Court questions need for PSI. State responds. Ferguson responds. Court reviews statute regarding PSI and what is included in it or purpose of it. Court not likely to grant Ferguson's request regarding no recommendation on PSI. Ferguson asking for time to obtain alternate PSI if needed once DOC's PSI is received. Bradley agrees. 15CF80 - Bradley pleads NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #4; 15CF65 - Bradley pleads NC to count #1, Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3, Court amends count #4 to misd bail jumping contrary to 941.49(1) and deleting repeater allegation - reads new penalties, Bradley pleads NC to amended count #4; 14CF153 - Bradley pleads NC to counts #2 and #3, court dismisses and reads in count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty. Court orders PSI on all cases as normal. Court continues bond, set for sentencing hearing. State is not asking for remandment to FOSO for stated reasons. Ferguson has no sentencing argument at this point. PSI to be completed by 9/16/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Gregory Adam Bradley, in custody and in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:57 PM. State in anticipation of waiving PH, has filed INFO which mirrors complaint. Court goes over questionnaire form for PH, finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Ferguson has INFO and waives further reading. Proceed to ARGN, enter NG pleas and asks for FPT. Court accepts plea. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
